alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 24 at 6:18PM MST until July 24 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 618 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Tumbleweed Park to near Queen Creek to near San Tan Valley to near Florence, moving northeast at 20 mph. Localized dust channeling has been oserved. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 165 and 184. US Highway 60 between mile markers 182 and 218. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 132 and 170. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, East Mesa, Queen Creek, Gold Camp, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley, Seville, and Freestone Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
